# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code that satisfies your request:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s)
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = word
        else
            line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    return result * "\n" * line  # In case the last line was not added yet.
end
```

You can use this function by passing a string and optionally specifying your preferred text width:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", 20))
```

This code will break the input string into words. It starts a new line whenever adding a word to an existing line would exceed the specified width. The resulting output is a string where every line does not exceed the given width.
